intro: Oxylobium genistoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf broom, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight zigzag or wavy edge, giving it a distinctive appearance. Oxylobium genistoides is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes, and it has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria.
